decks.notes: This UW Control deck focuses on maximizing board control and preventing opponent actions through counterspells, removal spells, and creature bounce effects. The deck aims to outlast opponents with a careful balance of card advantage and disruption, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds a tribal synergy element to the deck. By carefully managing resources and timing spells effectively, it strives to outmaneuver and outpace opponents to secure victory through attrition and careful planning.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to put pressure on the opponent quickly. With cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, this deck aims to deal damage as quickly as possible. Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent provide card advantage and flexibility, while cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Emberheart Challenger can help push through blockers. Overall, this deck is all about applying pressure early and maintaining it throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and disrupting opponent's plans with cards like Thalia and Archon of Emeria. By using mana dorks like Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to accelerate the board and deploy threats quickly. Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition provide additional value and removal options. The deck also includes some resilient threats like Ouroboroid and Enduring Innocence to keep applying pressure. The mana base is designed to support the double white and green requirements of the creatures and spells in the deck.

This UW Control deck focuses on locking down the opponent's board and hand while controlling the game through counter spells and removal. The deck utilizes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Supreme Verdict to maintain control of the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the addition of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion, the deck gains additional value and flexibility. By utilizing its powerful control tools and strategic plays, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast its opponents to secure victory.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. It utilizes mana dorks such as Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to ramp into powerful spells like Collected Company and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps slow down opponents while Enduring Innocence and Badgermole Cub provide resilience and staying power. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of threats while maintaining control over the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to deploy quick and efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Emberheart Challenger, and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Stormchaser's Talent to deal damage and control the board. The deck also includes card draw spells like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics to maintain hand advantage. The mana base is optimized with lands like Shivan Reef and Spirebluff Canal to ensure smooth mana production. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain tempo to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. Utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, the goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, while also using spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and remove opposing threats. The deck aims to be fast-paced and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent from the start of the game and maintaining that pressure throughout. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay to quickly overwhelm opponents. Utilizing cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, the deck aims to deal damage early and often. Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics provide disruption while Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage offer additional damage output. The deck also features a mix of spells and creatures to maintain pressure on the opponent, with cards like Heroes' Hangout and Den of the Bugbear for additional threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently dealing damage and controlling the board to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost aggressive creatures and using various spells to damage opponents and control the board. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, high-pressure strategy that combines creature aggression and direct damage spells to secure victory. The deck emphasizes tempo and efficiency, utilizing a mix of cheap spells and creatures to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent into making unfavorable trades. It is designed to be proactive and aggressive, aiming to close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck aims to control the game through powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Gifted Aetherborn, while also utilizing Mutavault for additional pressure. The deck also includes cards like Pest Control and Get Lost for added disruption and control over the opponent's game plan. Brightclimb Pathway and Bleachbone Verge provide additional resources and flexibility in mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a mix of removal, counter spells, and card draw to maintain board presence and prevent the opponent from gaining an advantage. The deck focuses on tempo plays and efficiently dealing with threats while also generating card advantage through spells like Divide by Zero and Accumulate Wisdom. With a mix of creatures and spells like Firebending Lesson and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and outlast them in the long game.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of burn spells and creatures that can quickly deal damage to the opponent. It aims to control the board by utilizing efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, while also taking advantage of burn spells like Torch the Tower and Emberheart Challenger to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Experimental Synthesizer to provide card advantage and flexibility in different matchups. The key strategy is to pressure the opponent early and maintain a fast pace throughout the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells like Reckless Rage and Fiery Impulse to control the board and clear the way for attacks. Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent provide card advantage and additional damage. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent, using a combination of creatures and spells to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger, supported by burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower. The deck also utilizes card draw and card advantage through spells like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent. The mana base includes lands that can produce both red and blue mana efficiently to support the deck's color requirements. Overall, the strategy revolves around applying early pressure and maintaining a quick tempo to defeat the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck aims to constantly apply pressure and close out the game quickly, utilizing cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Experimental Synthesizer to maintain card advantage and keep the aggression going. The inclusion of cards like Den of the Bugbear and Riverpyre Verge provide additional sources of damage and flexibility in combat.

The deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with bounce spells and counter spells. It aims to establish early board presence with cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, then finish off the opponent with direct damage spells like Burst Lightning and Emberheart Challenger. The deck also includes cards like Heroes' Hangout and Stormchaser's Talent to help maintain card advantage and add extra pressure on the opponent.
